title: Non-Game of The Year Awards 2020 - The Blessing Show
description:
It's a new year so there's no better time than now to take a look back. In this episode of The Blessing Show, Blessing breaks down what's up with 2020 in video games.

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Blessing - http://www.twitter.com/BlessingJr
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Blessing Adeoye Jr., and Tim Gettys talk about the biggest stories in Video Games.

Background Wall Art by Orioto - https://www.facebook.com/OriotoPosters/

transcript_chunks.text: welcome to the blessing show where i break down what's up it's a brand new show for a brand new year so let's talk about what's up with 2020 in video games it was a year of big blockbuster titles shiny new consoles animal crossing bringing momentary world peace and hades finally proving my point that rogue lights are fantastic various awards shows have already taken place highlighting the games of the year across multiple different categories games like the last was part 2 hades final fantasy 7 remake and others shine bright deservingly so but video games in 2020 exceeded way beyond the best and most popular so on this inaugural episode of the blessing show i want to present my own personal award show free from the glamour and grand nature of your typical game of the year awards i want to talk about the games that did something unique good or bad games that flew under the radar and games that i personally just really liked so without further ado here are your first annual the blessing

talk about the games that did something unique good or bad games that flew under the radar and games that i personally just really liked so without further ado here are your first annual the blessing show 2020 non game of the year awards best breath of the wild award what an incredible year for breath of the wild like games whether we want to talk about ubisoft's immortals phoenix rising which pause there also wins the award for worst name of the year or the literal breath of the wild prequel hybrid warriors age of calamity finally 2017's breath of the wild got the love it deserved in the year 2020 but this year no game breath of the wild did better in my eyes than the free to play gentian impact its vibrant colorful open world coupled with the crazy amount of customization available from characters to weapons made for quite the fun experience the game was able to capture that wondrous feeling of scaling a hill or gliding across a field or fighting like creatures with elemental

from characters to weapons made for quite the fun experience the game was able to capture that wondrous feeling of scaling a hill or gliding across a field or fighting like creatures with elemental properties the zelda isms are there in full force but the thing i like about gentian impact over a game like immortal phoenix rising are the ways in which it confidently separates itself letting me switch between characters on the fly use special elemental abilities or constantly be annoyed by paimon in these ways genshin felt fresh best port of a random old game if 2020 was the year of anything it might have been the year of old games making a comeback between reimaginings like resident evil 3 demon souls and final fantasy vii remake franchise returns like half-life alex collections like super mario 3d all-stars or whatever 13 was supposed to be it's trash not to mention normal heroes 1 and 2 making their way to switch and letting me re-experience some of sudo 51's best work but the port

mario 3d all-stars or whatever 13 was supposed to be it's trash not to mention normal heroes 1 and 2 making their way to switch and letting me re-experience some of sudo 51's best work but the port that surprised me the most in 2020 is that of a game called moon otherwise known as moon remix rpg adventure the game was originally a japan-only ps1 release in 1997 branded as an anti-rpg for its unconventional systems lack of combat and overall surreal vibe it went on to inspire successors including a game you might have heard of called undertale the game's release on switch marks its debut in the west and if i could recommend a random port of an old game in 2020 for you to check out it'd probably be this one the it deserved better award darwin project didn't deserve to fail and resident evil 3 should have felt like more than an expansion of resident evil 2. the real answer to this one though is dreams dreams is an incredible tool for creatives and i had a blast discovering the selection

3 should have felt like more than an expansion of resident evil 2. the real answer to this one though is dreams dreams is an incredible tool for creatives and i had a blast discovering the selection of random small experiences in the game from fun comedic walking sims to mascot kart racers and everything in between for the wonderful platform that it is i just wish dreams would have seen that payoff in success the game is almost too creative for its own good in ways that make it difficult to market to a large audience here's hoping media molecule and playstation continue to build on dreams and make it even bigger and better in 2021 best game that reminded me of portal that technically came out on pc in 2019 but i played it in 2020 because it came to playstation award this is a really specific category and i know what you're thinking which one game is blessing talking about here joke's on you i'm actually talking about two games main full garden and super liminal are both first person

category and i know what you're thinking which one game is blessing talking about here joke's on you i'm actually talking about two games main full garden and super liminal are both first person puzzle games where you attempt to escape a complicated endless loop of physical space and time by solving an escalating series of puzzles which involve you shifting your perspective picking up items and placing them to your benefit in order to progress the games are made by different developers and have nothing to do with each other but oddly enough both came out in fall of 2019 for the pc then made their way to playstation in summer of 2020. both games also happened to blow me away 2020 was a great year for me in puzzle games bad year for everything else manifold garden takes the cake in this category because of his commitment to its mcsuresque themes and art style which work in conjunction to deliver an experience that feels beautifully all in one it's an artwork of a game and the puzzles

because of his commitment to its mcsuresque themes and art style which work in conjunction to deliver an experience that feels beautifully all in one it's an artwork of a game and the puzzles are super dope best way to destroy a friendship i went to do like things it's fiona it's fiona it's fiona it is fiona oh you're always gonna come like me and jeremy left jeremy and i didn't leave the madness you [ __ ] up do that let's go baby the india as hell indie game award 2020 had no shortage of great indie games hades and fall guys being the shining gems of the year with games like ghost runners spirit fair and carrion hanging right in there with them every now and then though comes an indie game that feels like it really embodies the indie moniker whether that's by a uniquely focused vision ambitious use of limited resources or straight up attitude and if we're talking about attitude we're talking about huntdown huntdown is an explosive 2d action game that harkens back to the stylings of

use of limited resources or straight up attitude and if we're talking about attitude we're talking about huntdown huntdown is an explosive 2d action game that harkens back to the stylings of games like contra and metal slug bullets and bodies fly across the screen weapon pickups make you feel multiple times more powerful and boss fights constantly up the ante it's the exact type of experience you'd want from a game looking to emulate some of our favorite super nintendo memories and hunt down does this in a way only an indie ass indie game can the i played a ton of it despite its flaws award while greg miller was grinding away in marvel's avengers to max out his characters i was playing skater xl a skate game which launched with very few levels no objectives outside of completing a list of tricks and very few options in terms of customization i still somehow managed to put many hours into this dm game trying to connect a heel flip to a grind and land into a nose manual i've never felt

tricks and very few options in terms of customization i still somehow managed to put many hours into this dm game trying to connect a heel flip to a grind and land into a nose manual i've never felt more thirsty for skate 4. the should have gotten more love award lots of great games came out in the year 2020 and in a perfect world we'd get to give them all the love they deserved though in reality with so many games coming out weekly that means many of them are going to get overlooked in bigger conversations my winner for this category is actually a tie between 13 sentinels aegis rim and paradise killer both games that had fantastic art styles uniquely expressed narratives and characters with some of the most vibrant personalities i've seen out of games all last year and though i'm sitting right in front of you here today to tell you how these games deserve more love frankly i'm a part of the problem i started both these games and was enamored with the presentation and quality of them

right in front of you here today to tell you how these games deserve more love frankly i'm a part of the problem i started both these games and was enamored with the presentation and quality of them both but eventually abandoned them so i could play and review bigger and more popular games i'm even more ashamed to tell you that those games were marvel's avengers and star wars squadrons both fine games but probably not worth derailing me from those other two alright it's time the big award every game strives for at the end of the year the 2020 not game of the year game of the year award ghost of tsushima legends technically a mode within ghost sushima but in my opinion so excellent that it deserves its own award just when i thought i was done with tsushima legends came out and made me double my playtime with comparable quality and length to the single player campaign along with its own fantastical twist and cooperative gameplay legends ended up being the most fun i had with a game last

my playtime with comparable quality and length to the single player campaign along with its own fantastical twist and cooperative gameplay legends ended up being the most fun i had with a game last year it all culminates in a multi-chapter raid that took me and three friends about seven hours to complete it's a gem of a mode within one of the biggest games of the year that i believe deserves more hype beyond just being part of ghost of sushima it's also more than deserving of the not game of the year game of the year award this is just a game award this isn't a blessing show game award i didn't have the funds or the resources to produce one and so jeff keeley please don't sue me [Music] [Music] you
